_header: Whilom there was dwelling in Oxenford
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Miller’s Tale in the Canterbury Tales — 666 lines in rhyming couplets

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Whilom ther was dwelling in OxenfordeA riche choff that gestis
                    helde to borde…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…and Nicholas is scalded in his tovtethis tale is don &
                    god saue all the route
BodArcSelB14.Note:
I.3291-2 and 3721-2 inserted at foot of page; blanks left in I.3316,
                    3336; 3339-40 inverted.
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next folwith / his tale of a Carpenter & his wiff & of
                    hende Nicholas (f. 48); the Miller (RT); Here endith the miller his tale of
                    Absolon and / hende Nicholas (f. 57v)

BodBar20.First Lines:
Wylom þer was dwellyng in OxenfordA Riche gnoff þat
                    gestes held to bord…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…And Nicholas is scaldid in his touteÞis tale is don and
                    god saue al þe route
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
Here endyth þe milleris tale… (f. 43); The Miller (RT); Here
                    endith þe Milleris tale… (f. 43)

Bod414.First Lines:
[W]Hilom ther was duelling in OxenfordA riche gnoffe that gestis
                    held to bord…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…And Nicholas is scallid in his touteThis tale is done and god
                    saue al þe rout

Bod686.First Lines:
…As brode as is þe boos of a bokelyrHir shoes were laced
                    vpon hir legges hye…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…And Nicholas was skalded in þe towteÞis tale is don
                    god save al þe rowte
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Myllere/Millere (RT); Here eneth þe Millers tale… (f.
                    48)

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
…Hir forhede shone as bright as eny daySo was it wasshe when
                    she lefte hir werke…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…Began for to sigh sore and saide allasShall alle the worlde
                    be lost efte sones now…

WHilhom þere was dwelling in oxenfordeA ryche gnoff þat

                    lost.

grayel myssal and holy Euangelof Marke alkyndys wryten fayre and wel

                    albyonand his instrumentys euerichonof smale and grete many onfor

                    (RT)

TokyoTak32.First Lines:
Whilum ther was dwellyngge in OxenfordA Riche gnvffe that gestis
                    hadde to borde…
TokyoTak32.Last Lines:
…And Nicholas is skalded in his towteThis tale is doon god
                    save all this Rowte
TokyoTak32.Attributed Title:
Here bee gynniht the tale (f. 37rb); Thee Mellere (RT);
                        Explicit fabula Molendinarij (f. 41vb)

Bodmer48.First Lines:
Whilom þer was duelling in OxenfordA riche gnoffe þat
                    gestis held to bord…
Bodmer48.Last Lines:
…And nicholas is scallid in his touteThis tale is done &
                    god saue al þe Rout
